tokens.name: It is an app to help build routes for your cycle, run, hike all out door activities.
They also have ready built routes so you can do routes that other people have made so you know they have been tried and tested.
It has voice navigation so as you are cycling along you can hear the next turn you are going to take.
You can download individual routes or just the entire maps for when you are offline.
The app also allows you to share the route to your friends  and followers and you can share it to the entire kamoot community.
The App shows you all the routes available on your doorstep so you do not have to travel far to discover new parts of the countryside and footpaths.

I like the layout,
its simple to use 
and i like how detailed the routes are

I dont like the subscription cost as you have to pay more to get more maps
its not compatible with my old phone
its not as well known in my circle of friends.
I think the price point could be more standerdised Even have free trials so people may be inclied to give it a go.
Komoot is an app that enables cyclists, runners, and hikers to plan, discover, and travel along routes anywhere in the world.

The app is partially community driven, in that users can add features and points of interest to help other users discover interesting locations in new cities, or even discover new locations within their own home towns.
Users can define their method of travel, such as gravel bike, bike tour, running, hiking, and their level of fitness, to ensure that the chosen route is appropriate.
Komoot breaks countries down in to different regions, and users can purchase those regions to get access to additional features.

Importantly, this includes turn-by-turn navigation and offline maps, so if one wishes to follow an 80 kilometre bike route, they can load it to a smartphone or cycling computer and use Komoot throughout the entire journey.

Turn-by-turn navigation: I am an enthusiastic road cyclist, and I like that I can confidently ride in any distance, knowing that I can head off in a new location and just follow the instructions given on my smartphone, or if something happens that I can use Komoot to quickly change my route and navigate home.
Community-driven: I like that people add points of interest that nobody other than a local could know about, and that other users can then rate it and let you know if it is really worth visiting.
This is useful for more than just sport, when I am in a new city with the kids I always use Komoot to see what the local parks and playgrounds are like so I can find fun places to play with my kids.
Recommendations: The curated lists such as "20 best walks in Region X" are also very interesting.
I enjoy seeing what they come up with for regions that I am familiar with, as well as planning walks when I visit a new city.
No live-traffic intergration: It can be incredibly frustrating when you plan a route, and then you discover numerous road closures or other obstacles.
Sometimes, such as in the case of a bridge closure, one can not make a detour and you are forced to simply return home.

Not being able to cut off certain sections in the planner: Sometimes I find an interesting waypoint that I want to include on my ride, but the waypoint automatically ads an 800 metre section, for example.
If I want to turn off maybe after 500 meters, there is no way for me to shorten that section other than to remove the way point entirely.
The general route planner on mobile: It can be very difficult to move waypoints and set precise routes on mobile.
The main improvement that I would like is intergration with road-closure update services.

I realise this is difficult to do using open street map and would probably incur a cost, but it can be incredibly frustrating to find a bridge is closed, or if a special event or roadworks cut off an entire section of a journey.
In a foreign city, it isn't always so easy to find alternative routes.
The Komoot App is an app that helps you plan and track routes for any outdoor activities such as running, biking, hiking, jogging, mountain biking and many more.
You can plan ahead and see other routes that have been taken before.
While you are doing your activity you can track your own heart rate.
You can buy routes, maps and regions on the app for a few euros.
The app is growing more and more and you can get suggestions for specific regions that will help you figure out the perfect plan for what you want to do.
There are also pictures to help visualize what the tracks look like and what certain stations look like.
I like that it offers so many different tracks.
I like that it offers many different exercises or rather tracks for different exercises.
I like that it is interactive during use.
I don't like some of the prices.
I don't like when the app crashes.
I don't like that you can't communicate with Users directly
I think a good improvement you be to figure out how the app can use less data or make it that you have to approve because it uses a lot of data fast and that can be a big issue.
The Komoot App is a route planning and navigation app that allows you to plan routes.
You can access this app on your mobile device or laptop.
When using the app on your laptop, you can save or send your planned routes to your mobile device.

Kamoot has a start and an end point to plan your routes, and will tell you the distance, elevation profile, road surface fitness level required, difficulty and the time estimated to complete the route.
It can be used without an internet connection however, if you have an internet connection you can reroute if you decide to head in a different direction to the planned route.
The Kamoot app is affordable for anyone that wishes to use it.
It has voice navigation so you don't need to take your eyes off the road and look what direction you should be heading in.
It allows you to connect with your friends/other Kamoot users.
Data can be inaccurate if you come across a fairly new area.
The highlights don't always show up.
If it was free it would be accessible by individuals who do not wish to pay for apps.
Updating on a regular basis so all new areas are included.
Komoot is an App to help you plan or find routes.
I personally have used it when I've been in new areas with my bike and want to find good cycle routes.
It is also good for finding walking routes.
The distance and intensity can be changed which is excellent if you have children with you.
I like the ability to be able to completely customise your route and the ability to use it offline if neccesary as often whilst cycling or walking in the mountains it is hard to get a signal.
I use the free app as I do not often use it from my home but it is definitely worth purchasing the full version if you often walk or cycle in different environments.
I like to ability to customise your route.
I like that you can search new areas to find new routes and I like being able to select how far I want to go..
I dislike that its not the easiest or clearest to use sometimes.
I don't dislike anything else.
I am unsure what could impove Komoot as I think its a really good app anyway, perhaps more routes.
Komoot is a free to download app on the play store to assist with cycling and walking adventures/exercise.
It works a little like Google maps but shows short cuts or more scenic routes to take.

Giving distance travelled and how long until reach destination it is a handy map app
Also gives feedback on how fit you are based on time taken to do the journey.
Functions such as record help to keep track of travelling done and if want to share.

The download option allows user to download for example their hometown map to use for walking etc if didn't have access to WiFi
Great for planning ahead

Planning walks ahead of the trip 

Recording my journeys to share with family and friends

Alternative routes it provides for scenic experiences

Downloading maps to use when have no data or WiFi

Easy to use layout of the app

The fact its free to download and use

The advertisements

Pay to use a pro feature

Sometimes lags when downloading maps (may be my storage or Internet connection)

Add more exercise features

Extend the 'free' features

Could add a chat section to communicate with friends via and arrange walks between 2 parties
The komoot app is an app that lets you plan routes outdoors for cycling, running, exploring etc.
It allows you to make your own routes, or follow their pre planned ones for you.
You can tailor these routes depending on your fitness levels or time.

The komoot app allows you to really get to know, and explore an area and make it suitable to exactly what your looking for one that paticular day, whether its type of terrain, type of activity, length or discovery.
The komoot app allows you to really explore and adventure, and keep your interest and passion for outdoor activity and sports.
Its the perfect exploring companion.
I like that you can tailor it to exactly what you want to get from your activity that day
Nothing i can think of
Maybe more secret or 'hidden gem' routes
Komoot is the most intuitive route planning app on the market.
It saves me time and allows me to more easily experience adventure.

No matter how secluded the path or how off-road the trail, komoot’s turn-by-turn voice navigation will ensure you’re always going where you’re supposed to be—without ever distracting you from your surroundings.
And as the great outdoors never comes with strong signal, everything works offline.

Just conveniently download individual routes or entire maps for use offline, and stay on course when coverage falls short—no matter how off-grid you go.With komoot I can easily adapt my hiking plans wherever I am, allowing me to easily explore more of the outdoors!Really good app on my phone that helps me plan and follow my route it all so keeps me in touch with friends and what's happening and ideas for some fantastic new walks.
It's also fantastic when I travel to other countries and it shows me routes that other people have done.
Really good app on my phone that helps me plan and follow my route it all so keeps me in touch with friends and what's happening and ideas for some fantastic new walks.
It's also fantastic when I travel to other countries and it shows me routes that other people have done.
I did not find any bad side of the apps
It should be more user friendly sothat anyone can use this easily
The komoot app is an app that lets you plan your outdoor activities and adventures.
You can plan outdoor activities of all kinds such as cycling, hiking, running, exploring and many others.
The komoot app is a very versatile app that supports you to explore and ingrain yourself in local and not local areas with a range of maps and routes.
The app suggests routes you might try based on previous routes you may have tracked/taken but also others you may not have considered.
These routes can be pre planned for your which can be helpful for the beginner (and give them confidence), but also you can develop your own routes.
You can also tailor these routes to the time/length/type of activity you require which makes it really adaptable.
It suggests places and routes you might not have considered.
The flexibility it gives you around the type of outdoor activity you want to do and the time you have to do it.
I dont dislike anything about it really, I find it very useful.
I can't think of many ways it could be improved as I think its already a really adaptable and versatile app
The komoot app is a mobile app for smartphones for the field of navigation and route planning stuff by using normal GPS Data.
The app sign is green.
The app includes free and paid for futures.
It is possible to create routes and stuff like this for various outdoof activities  for example like running, walking and cycling.
The app was founded by some Germans and Austrians.
Komoot seems to be on of the biggest outdoor social network system within Europe.
The use of komoot is heplfull for families, experienced and unexperienced people with outdoor activities.
The app navigates by display or voice navigation.

- It is free
- The use is quite simple
- Ones can use it in a simply way
- Using GPS Data
To be honest i did not use Komoot that often due to the fact that i dont like outdoor activities.
I would definitly recommend to do more advertisment since the app seems to be quite unknown for unexperienced people.
Komoot App is used for planning biking and cycling trips.
It's used for route planning and navigation.
It will generate different routes depending on various variables (e.g.
riding type, rider ability, etc.).
You can discover places that other people like to ride or visit 'Highlights'.
You can see tips and recommendations like cafes, coffee shop, etc.
on Tours, which helps you to discover new places of interest in your area.
The app can be used in offline mode and will provide audible navigation.
Once a ride has been completed, you can upload it to your profile and add photos (similar to Strava).
It has better algorithms for route planning than other apps.
It has good routing capabilities, and you can discover similar routes that have been taken by other people.
It offers detailed information on road and trail type, and elevation so you are adequately informed on the trip and can prepare sufficiently.
It focuses on outdoor sports such as cycling or hiking.
You can also save routes online which is great as it saves on data!
Reliable and accurate voice navigation
The quality of highlights are very dependent on the area - there aren't many highlights in my local area, but there are lots around big cities.

The search function for existing routes that others have done can be difficult to use 
Gravel routing profile could be improved - need to add lots of waypoints
Gravel route planning can be improved.
Currently, it takes you on too many busy roads to save a few metres.
I already use Komoot for most of my planning and tracking, but prefer Strava for the community aspects.
Also, some of the recommended routes are not rideable.
Only the popular stuff is 100% reliable.
The app is not the most intuitive to use - there's a learning curve at the start, so this could be improved too.
Overall, Komoot is a brilliant app and it's definitely one of the best route planners out there.
Kamoot is an app that helps you plan and navigate your route using an algorithm.
It is useful for bike journeys because it can take your fitness and the terrain into account when it is planning your journey.
it uses your mobile phone GPS to find the way and then you can discover new routes and new places that you would not have otherwise known.
But it is not only a route finding app, it is also a community where you can share the best places you went with other users.
It is unusual because when you are already on a journey, you can actually change the journey you have already started and the app will re-navigate you to your destination.
It is different to other navigation apps.
It allows you to be part of a community with other users.
you feel safer while exploring.
I do not like the interface.
i'm not a fan of cycling.
im afraid other users will be unfriendly and not stick to community guidelines.
the interface and the accompanying website are really boring and unstimulating.
I think they should be more fun.
isn't biking and walking supposed to be fun and more accessible?
Komoot App is a great application, very useful for all travelers, hikers, cyclists, etc.
I use this application for route planning but mainly for navigation.
All maps are very detailed.
You also have information about the topography, about road type.
This is very helpful, especially when riding a bike.
The application interface is clean and very intuitive.
You can plan your routes very easily just with a few clicks.
A good thing is that every road can be saved and then shared with other Komoot users.
You can upload photos from the route, write comments.
I think Komoot is the best adventure navigation app.

Pros
- easy and clean interface
- simple route planning in a few steps
- very detailed maps (a lot of data, even topography)
- sharing routes with other users
- navigating module

Cons:
- I didn't notice, for me this app is perfect
I have no idea because everything is perfect and very well-balanced.
The Komoot app helps you find cycling, running and hiking routes within the region you would like and includes various information such as elevation of the route and photos uploaded by other users.
The app is easily usable by setting your region and it will then provide you with various routes.
The time is also included in these routes to help you make your selection along with what fitness level it is suitable for.
You can then save these routes for later if you do not want to do it at the time but are interested.
You can also customise these routes to meet with your needs.
The app is available in different languages.
The things I like about the app are how easy it is to use as the navigation is very straightforward.
It is also beneficial to have the fitness level within the route.
Lastly, the photos are useful to help you pick your route and to see what to expect on the way.

The 3 things I do not like about the app is that there could be an option to drive to a park and then walk from there as for some it is not the easiest to do full walks and they could prefer to drive to a pub for lunch and then carry out the walk.
The app does not have live GPS which would be better.
I also do not like that the map is not shown in the previews when looking at various routes.
If the app could be integrated to work with Live GPS and google maps this would be better.
It would also be a good idea to be able to share routes via facebook or social media with others before you go.
Another improvement would be to have the app working on fitness watches, as it could help navigate whilst cycling.
The Komoot app is a cycling and walking app, available to download on to phones on Google Play.
It is an app that provides maps and routes in your local area for cycling, hiking or running.

By downloading the app onto your phone, registering and allowing access to your phone's location, you can then view nearby ready made routes based on whether you want to hike, mountain bike or any other sport, and recommended routes will come up, this will include photos, times of the route and distance.
It will also include whether this is for experts or beginners.
You can also search for routes anywhere in the world.
You can follow other users and have them follow your profile, to see routes they have planned and completed.

I like that it is free to download and easy to sign up to and just by enabling my location, I have access to many interesting and varied routes to hike and cycle where I live, that I probably would not have known about if I had not downloaded this app.
I like the level of detail in each route, with the photos included, even if you don't actually go on the route, it is really interesting to read.
Also you can search worldwide and it is fascinating and a good way to learn about new places and plan and dream for possible trips.
I like the language used in the app and how it accessible and friendly and feels relevant to me personally.
There is nothing I dislike about Komoot, I have only had positive experiences with it.
Like any app you can use the parts that are relevant to you without necessarily using all aspects of the app that are not so relevant.
For instance I do not follow other people or have them follow me as this is not why I use the app.
The app has always worked well on my phone when inside and also outdoors, the location works well.
I do find that possibly it uses a lot of battery however there are other apps on my phone that also do this so it is not so unusual.
The Komoot app is a navigation, planning and tracking app.

It can be used for a variety of types of movement, but to my knowledge is especially popular with cyclists wanting to plan, navigate and track their cycles as well as find inspiration from fellow users of the app.

In the app itself you can create routes that you follow on your walk/run/cycle and according to the locations and plans you put in, will suggest the best and safest routes for your journey as well as give information about what surface you will have throughout the journey, something that can help in planning for example how suitable the route is for various bikes or fitness levels.
I like that I can learn and be inspired by other cyclists and find routes I may otherwise not have thought of.
I also really appreciate that the app plans out routes that are optimised for cyclists for both safety and comfort compared to what I normally experience with Google Maps.

I am not a bit fan of listening to the navigation whilst I cycle as I find that it doesn't automatically move to where I am at any given time if I happen to take a different route or miss a turn, so it just tells me to return and go backwards which I find tedious and rather not.

I wpuld make the GPS map navigation whilst cycling automatically update according to where I am and replan the route to the next location point on my planned route instead of telling me to go backwards.
This is done by Google and other apps and I would definitely use Komoot more if this worked.
Komoot App offers premade and customizable hiking and cycling routes, which can be filtered by distance, difficulty, public transport links and more.
Komoot App is available for mobile IOS and Android, which can also be used on the desktop,tablet, and android wear.
You can enjoy a seamless sync between all your devices.
There are also tools to make your perfect custom route as you see fit specific to sport and topographic routing.
Komoot App also offers turn by turn gps voice navigation during your route.
Individual routes and entire maps are available for download to be used offline so you never have to worry about getting lost without signal.
I like Komoot the most because it encourages me to go outside and enjoy nature.
I like using the ready made routes and checking out the highlight features of Komoot.
I do not like Komoot's preminum pricing as I find it a bit too expensive.
I do not like Komoot doesn't have the option to avoid high traffic roads.
I also do not like that Komoot map is sometimes buggy during navigation, jumping to another location than I am.
I believe cycling routes could be greatly improved, they often are less practical and encourages biking in areas not suitable.
Komoot is an activity tracker and activity suggestion app.
It can suggest you different routes with your desired features like distance, type of road, etc.
You can also plan your own route with different details and analysis and finally use the route for the day you start your activity (e.g., cycling).
Komoot also contains a good map and very useful for navigation.
Komoot is also knows as a social media for activities.
You can follow your friends and share your activity with them and they can react and comment on yours.
You can find what people think about certain routes and actually see their photos on the routes.
Komoot support cycling, hiking and some other similar activities as well.
I like the route planner feature where I can customize my desired route and save it and use it directly.
I also like explorer the available and suggested routes and explorer some routes I have never think of.

I it also very nice to save and keep track of your activities
The navigation and the map in the app is very useful compared to other apps such as google map.
The app used to be more stable before but recently I have faced some difficulties with the navigation and map!
I sometimes just want to keep the map on and don't use navigation but it seems that when you turn off your screen you need again to find yourself on the route!
Adding different maps like hiking with more details would be nice.
An app where you can plan walks.
If you are unsure of the trail it works like maps but better for the beaten track.
I have used it when I did the three peaks as some of the route is not well signposted and the koomoot app helped navigate us in the right direction.
Also helpful planning and saving the route before hand.
I’m sure you can do more than just use it for hikes but the riding a bike or running function is not suitable for me as I dislike fell running or off road biking.
I think this app would be very good in the case of an emergency.
Maybe pairing with something like 3 words?
So that you can log any emergency accurately

- gps in the country side
- finding routes and saving them
- distance and elevation expalidd

The app could look better
The design is poor
Logo a bit bland
Add what 3 words to the app - would be helpful in an emergency and also to pin point location
Komoot app is a navigation and route planning software that allows users to create and follow routes based on riding type and ability.
The app is designed to help users explore new places and discover new routes whilst providing ride recommendations for its 'community of riders'.
Komoot is one of the most popular route planning apps on the app market.
It has many functions that aim to make route planning an easier experience e.g.
Komoot will allow you to reroute when you are out on a ride if you decide you want to head somewhere different or change course.
Using a start and endpoint, Komoot will tell you the distance, elevation profile, road surface, fitness level required, difficulty and estimated time needed to complete the route.
I like the fact that you can use routes to navigate via your mobile phone or GPS without an internet connection.
This is useful as many times I cycle in paths with a lot of greenery and there isn't an internet connection.
I also like the strong community focus.
I usually discover new places to cycle and can use other people's routes that they have planned.
I like the simplicity of it.
I find everything is easy to use and is easy to access.
There isn't any option to win points or earn something at the end of a route.
I think it would be better if you earned points afterwards, which you could then collect and use towards something e.g.
if you get 500 points you get a free helmet.
I think Komoot could include some fitness training articles or blog posts to motivate users into a healthy lifestyle.
Sometimes the 'off-grid' function doesn't work for cycling.
I think this could be improved as it works better for running and hiking.
As stated in the last answer, I think some additional features could be included e.g.
points, better use of functions.
I also think the layout of the app could be redesigned to be more aesthetically pleasing e.g.
font, colours.
I would prefer using an app with a fun, playful layout.
This would motivate me to use the app and go on rides.
The Komoot App is an app that you can use on your phone that allows you to check out and plan routes.
You can walk these routes, or bike along them, or travel in any way you want.
There's a social component where you can check what others are doing and you can use this to get inspired or steal their routes (not really steal, but take the same route).
You can share pictures of where you are and what it looks like and use this as a way to set highlights of your story and traveling day.
I like that you can use it for free, but there's I think also a paid option if you want more or different features, or if you just want to support the creators.
I like that it's free.
I like that it's, when you get to know it, pretty easy to use.
I like the social component where you can see other peoples routes.
I dislike that some options costs money.
I dislike that it's not intuitive when you first get to use it.
I dislike how you need internet to use it, because sometimes outdoors there's not much internet.
(You can predownload the maps to somewhat alleviate this).
I think Komoot should become easier to use when you first start it up.
I found it pretty hard to get started with it because the UI is not intuitive.
It is an app that allows you to route plan and map your exercise, e.g., running, cycling, hiking, walking.
Users can see other people's routes and be inspired by their efforts/chosen routes.
Users can also add photos to their routes and follow their friends/other users to stay updated about their adventures.

In order to use, you must open the app before the exercise (such as just before running) and press start -  the Komoot app will then use GPS to track your journey and give you information about your efforts/speed/incline.
Voice navigation is also available, which is useful if you are unfamiliar with the route/area

You can see your fitness levels easily 
You can stay motivated by seeing other people's efforts
You can be inspired to take alternative routes

It is sometimes disheartening to think you have gone fast then the tracker shows you were slow
It can feel as though the exercise is for others and not yourself
I don't have a third point really - maybe sometimes it is difficult to use when the internet is bad!
It could be improved by ensuring it is simple to use when offline - I don't have another suggestion!
Komoot is a navigator app for bikers and hikers.
It provides the routes you can take and it can help you planning an outdoor excursion on foot or by bike.
It also gives an overview of the level of difficulty and assigns the best routes according to your level of expertise and physical shape.
On top of that, it provides indications of useful spots (toilets, stations, parkings, etc.).
One can also choose the type of landscape or attractions he wants to pass by, or select the type of excursion according to the people he is going with and to the time he wants to spend outside.
A nice part are the offline maps.
I like the fact that maps are offline and that we can select the level of difficulty of excursions.
I don't like that too many services, such as map layers, are premium.
The navigation interface could be improved.
Komoot is an app I can use to plan and map my trails when out and about.
It has navigation features and can suggest trails or routes.
It's a good alternative to gps / satnav for people who go offroad, or do some trail running / cycling / hiking.
There is a free version but the paid version gives you access to more features and trails.
Komoot can help me plan my hike or my bike ride, and can suggest good rides / runs / hikes nearby.
It also has a community of users who submit and rate routes.
When I'm on the route, it can navigate and give me directions just as a normal navigation app would do on the road.

Routes are relevant - good for the area I'm in
Routes show difficulty / hills etc
It's a good alternative to Google which is too cluttered

Runs slow on older phones
Paid version needed to get any real use of it
Sometimes it takes a long time to get to the actual map in the app

I would love a "shuffle / random" mode - the app detects my location, acknowledges my input (I have x hours to spare and want to do hiking / cycling), and sends me on a random trail with turn - by - turn directions.
Perfect for exploring new areas.
The Ko-moot app is designed to help assist the average traveller.
Wether it be on foot or by bike.
It helps you discover the countryside sorry everywhere by giving you options on trails.
I used this app when I walked the Camino.
You can set a filter for difficulty of the route so there are no sudden surprises that you may encounter on your walk.
Ko-moot can’t give you good detail on what the ground surface will be like in the walk ahead, so you can plan for it or otherwise select an alternative route or pathway.
You can connect.
With your Facebook friends list and also upload photos of previous walks so others can see.
I like that aspect as if you haven’t been somewhere and you’d like to go these photos gives you an rough idea of what to expect also it keeps the community close.
Also you can post pictures of things to look out for on certain trails to keep you on the right track and prevent you from swaying off course.
I like the interaction you can get with other friends doing their walks and exploring the countryside.
Also suggested walks on the main page opens my eyes from time to time
I have to say I think it’s a bit frustrating that you have to pay for maps in this app.
It’s a con, some places are free whole others aren’t and it if the whole app was free I would be promoting it more by word of mouth but nowadays nobody wants to pay for these things.
Price I think the app should stop charging for the maps, once it’s free and built up a larger following then start charging new comers again but until then.
Why should I have to pay to walk somewhere when I have google maps….
It's an app with which you can create and find sports routes all over the world.
It can guide you throughout the route and it can trace a new route as you walk, bike or hike.
You can also upload pictures of certain milestones within the route, so others can better orient themselves along the way.
Komoot can suggest routes based on your geographical location and preferred type of sport.
The distance, difficulty level, estimated duration time, and overall elevation of the selected route are available so that one can choose the path that better suits his or her needs.
It also has offline maps, so that you don't get lost along the way.
The fact that you can use the maps offline.
The fact that you can trace a new route on the go.
The fact that you have available pictures as to not get confused along the way, particularly when hiking.
The interface could be cleaner.
Importing new routes can be a bit of a hassle.
The rerouting function could be better.
It may be positive to include a trial for the premium features, as to draw more people in and get a sense of what one would be paying for.
Although necessary, sometimes it can be graphically overwhelming to see all of the road possibilities outlined in black.
It may be nice to have an option to turn them off or let them disappear after zooming out a little bit.
It is a navigation and route planning app.
This app enables users to create and follow rotes based on riding type and ability.
The Komoot App allows people to plan routes on their mobiles or computers and generates routes based on riding type, surface and rider ability.

It is designed to help users explore new places and discover new routes as well as provide ride recommendations through its ‘community’ of riders, Komoot is one of the most popular route planning apps on the market and has many functions that aim to make route planning an easier experience.
Using a start and endpoint, Komoot will tell you the distance, elevation profile, road surface, fitness level required, difficulty and estimated time needed to complete the route.
The app also has a strong community focus.
This means you can discover places other users like to ride or visit (‘Highlights’ in Komoot parlance), such as particular climbs, cafes or points of interest and integrate these into your ride.
When riding, the Komoot app will tell us speed, distance travelled, distance remaining and let us alter the route on the fly.
The app reduces personal options and pushes us  towards routes they've pulled in from elsewhere.
The routes can't be relied on to be any good.
App feels super slow on an iPhone 10 with the latest iOS version.
So I would improve it’s speed and reliability because after riding some hours with navigation  it crashes.
I know it crashes more often than other apps like Google Maps, Strava.
The app i believe is an app which can be used across all phone decides such as iPhones and androids.
Essentially it just allows you to plan your route from a to b.
You can do this and then send your planned route to your other devices.
For example if you plan this on your laptop it can be sent to your iPad or iPhone.
Like a sat nav it can also reroute you if you go off track or if you wanted to try or accidentally went the wrong way it would still get you to the same end destination that you had planned.
It can be used by all ages and could be deemed as a safe app as it’s use is to ensure people get to where they need to be.
That it can be used across all platforms.
E.g iPhones and laptops.
Nothing
To possibly not go off on a tangent and over complicate it by doing things such as ‘highlights’.
Insisting people try other places when they may possibly only want to use it for the intended route.
The Komoot App is an app for bikers.
It allows you to record your tours with your bike if you have a GPS capable phone, you can add pictures and videos directly taken on the track.
The most useful thing is to sync it between the PC and the mobile phone, in that way you can create your own maps on the PC and transfer them offline to your phone or wearable watch.
The importance of offline maps is key to when you'll find yourself outdoor, with no signal on your mobile phone, this app allows you to progress anyway through the track or recover the lost path.

Another cool feature is the voice navigation control, when you've successfully imported a track it will guide you with a vocal system, so that you don't have to necessarily watch your phone while riding.

- I like the ease of use of the app on both the mobile phone and pc
- I like the possibility to use it offline since I don't always get good phone signal
- I like the fact that it links directly the pictures and videos to the track

- I don't like the amount of advertisement inside the app and the price of the packages
- I don't like the privacy, it's not clear whether the app is running and collecting infos
- Sometimes the GPS is wonky, on google maps it shows good, but the altitude seems wrong on the app
Definitely the price of the packages are too expensive.
You may be getting more purchases if you lower them.
I've tried it once on an iphone and it didn't work as fluently as the android version.
This is a mobile app for people who enjoy walking or ride bikes.
Its an app that helps riders and walkers to find routes in the local areas.
When using the app you can enter different ability levels and types of rides to suit your desires and needs.

It also offers navigation while your walking or riding and you don't have to look at your screen while following directions as its voice activated so very useful as you can concentrate  on the route and walking or cycling.
I personally use it for walking and people can rate the walk and the walk also saves and tracks the time and distance you completed so you can look back at the route.
I like that it saves all the walking information and the route you completed.
I like the voice activation so you dont have to always watch the screen.
NA
It does use a lot of battery while walking.
The Komoot App is an app that lets you either make a route for hiking.
You can either make a route completely yourself using the tech provided in the app or you can use an entire pre-made route you can follow.
With making the routes you can choose between many options.

The options range between the usage of road bikes, mountain bikes or even normal hikes, but also you can choose between different routing, like mostly sport-specific routes or topographic routes and many more.
Also when you have selected a pre-made route or you made a route yourself it will download it on your device.
This means you can even use it when you are offline or when the signal is really bad
What I like mostly is the creativity you can throw into a route, you have many choices how the route will look like.
Also I think the different types of routes are really good.
Lastly I find the offline feature really important, I have had some troubles without internet before making a hike and almost being lost.
I have had troubles making a route that is sort of combined between sport and photographic routes.
This might be because my phone is also pretty old, but whenever I use the app my battery drains insanely fast.
Also a combination between hiking and biking has been tough to make, most of the routes is made for 1 purpose.
The thing I would improve the most is making combinations in routes, for example that it lets you make a route with partially biking and hiking, photographic, but also some sport-specific moments.
This might be useful for people like me who travel a lot and want to combine them both to also see the country/nature, but also in the meantime get that cardio in.
From what I know about the komoot app it is a route planner for walks and hikes and bike rides.
You can plan out your routes you want to take.it’s abit like a gps but for you and not your car.
You can save your routes for using again another time.
I have only used the app once while walking at my local river/ country park.
I did find it very useful but as I knew the area quite well it probably wasn’t as affective as it would of been had I not known the area.
It’s handy to explore new places with and can stop you getting lost and help you find new areas!
It will definitely make my life easier in the summer when we go on even more walks
I love the navigation of being able to see where I am going.
I kind of feel it is more aimed at cyclists which is why I’ve not used it again since the first time I used it.
I feel it could be improved by making it seem more like it is aimed at walkers too and maybe those with familys.
Showing more family routes would be very good and maybe a children’s version for the children to have with them on there phones would be lovely.
Not sure if that already exists but would be a good idea if not
The Komoot app is a route planning and navigation software to plan routes or to discover new routes and places.
It can help cyclers and hikers find the optimal route, check the weather, find optimal places for breaks.
The roads can be viewed offline as well and in case some routes that the user may know that do not already exist in the app they have the ability to add it and share it with the community.
It can be used on the desktop or laptop as well as on the smarphone or a navigation device ( cycling computer).
One can also record routes and share photos of places one rode to and of course it can be used to change routes during the ride.
I like the fact that it is like a community for riders which provides inspirations for riders on their next road trips.
Some of the best features are not free such as the offline road tracking.
Since on some routes the connection might not be as stable if it at all exists.
Maybe provide at least in a limited way some of the paid features for free.
